item.title: Dashboard
item.description: The Ocean dashboard summarizes your freight spend information and provides a search box for finding market prices for trade lanes. Overview The Ocean dashboard contains a port-to-port search and a number of sub-sections that detail your performance against the market. You can use the dashboard to understand your position in the market and to quickly navigate between different features of Xeneta. Dashboard — Xeneta Ocean You can return to the dashboard at any time by clicking the Xeneta logo in the top-left corner of the app.

item.title: Getting Started
item.description: Xeneta’s platform offers you a number of tools to help you understand the freight market. Here you can find some basic use cases for the Xeneta platform. Ocean View a summary of your freight rates Use the dashboard to get an overview of your rates and how they compare to the market. Get a spot rate for a trade lane Use the trade lane search from the dashboard to retrieve today's market rates for any origin and destination port across a number of container types.

item.title: Overview
item.description: Xeneta for Air Freight is an analytics and benchmark platform for understanding the prices of the air freight market. The Dashboard Like the Ocean dashboard, the Air freight dashboard contains a port-to-port search bar and a summary of your price coverage and price benchmarks. Dashboard — Xeneta for Air Freight The Port-to-port Search The port-to-port search on the dashboard is used to find spot rates for air freight.

item.title: My Prices
item.description: The My Prices page collects your air freight rates and organizes them into a number of categories for convenient analysis. For an in-depth look at the My Prices page in Xeneta for Air Freight, read our help article. Overview The My Prices page lists every rate you’ve uploaded into Xeneta. It contains a number of filters — including transit time, weight break, and service type — to help you find the rates relevant to you.

item.title: Search
item.description: The port-to-port search allows you to find today’s rate for the majority of port-to-port combinations in the world across a variety of container types. Overview The port-to-port search bar can be found on the dashboard and at the top of any graphs page. The port-to-port search with a result. Simply enter an origin port and a destination port, select your preferred container type, and click Search.

item.title: Uploading Rates
item.description: One of the core features of the Xeneta platform is the ability to benchmark your rates against the market. Benchmarking is another way of saying “comparing” — that is, you compare the prices you pay for shipping against other market participants as a whole. Benchmarking can help you understand how much you pay relative to the market and can, in turn, give you the insight you need to negotiate better rates in the future.

item.title: My Prices
item.description: The My Prices page organizes your uploaded freight rates into a number of categories to help you understand your prices across the market. Overview The My Prices page lists every rate you’ve uploaded into Xeneta. It contains a number of filters — including origin, destination, supplier, and container type — to help you find the rates relevant to you. The My Prices page. My Prices functionality is only available if you’ve uploaded your freight rates into Xeneta.

item.title: Regions
item.description: To categorize and analyze the movement of freight, Xeneta organizes ports into regional and sub-regional groups. The mapping is done to give a better view into the way geography plays into freight prices. To reflect this, nearby ports with similar costs of shipping will be grouped together. Geographic Hierarchy The availability of freight data fluctuates throughout the year and Xeneta may not always have optimal freight rate coverage to provide to the user.

item.title: Market Metrics
item.description: For an in-depth look at Market Metrics, read our article in the help center. Market metrics are a set of options that control how freight rate data is displayed in Xeneta. You can think of them as a global-level filters for rate information. They appear in the top-right corner of on any pages capable of showing freight data — including Air and Ocean dashboards. Market metrics for ocean freight. Currently, Xeneta uses 3 types of market metrics across both Ocean and Air freight products:

item.title: Spend Overview
item.description: For an in-depth look at the Spend Overview page, read our help center article. The Spend Overview page ties together your freight volume and its associated prices with the rest of the market. Overview The Spend Overview helps you understand how much your freight prices can improve in terms of dollar value. Xeneta refers to this as the Saving Potential — the theoretical savings that can be achieved if the prices you paid for freight matched the price paid by different segments of the market.

item.title: Graphs
item.description: Graphs are a tool for visualizing your freight rates in relation to the market and your own suppliers. Overview Xeneta provides three types of graphs to help you understand your rates: The Benchmarks graph The Trends graph The Carrier Spread graph All graphs in Xeneta have a number of filters to help you narrow the scope of the rates you’re viewing, including filters for date range, container type, contract duration, and terminal handling charges (THC).

item.title: API
item.description: The Xeneta API can be used to work with rate information programmatically. For more information about getting API access, read this article. See the API reference for technical details.

item.title: Reports
item.description: Xeneta can create a number of Excel reports based on the analytics data found on our platform. Any page capable of exporting an Excel report will contain a symbol in the top-right corner of the page. You can find all your created reports on the Reports page. Note: A number of larger reports will take some time to generate. In such cases, you’ll be notified by email when your report is ready.
